decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The developments to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years, beginning with the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 51365-AAM-WXX-XX-DR-A-07100_LV Cabinet Site Location Plan; 51365-AAM-WXX-XX-DR-A-07101_LV Cabinet GA; 51365-AAM-WXX-XX-DR-A-07200_LV Cabinet Section size; 51365-LUC-WXX-XX-SK-L-15210 LV Cabinet Landscape Proposals

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - The development hereby permitted shall only be erected from 25th April 2023 and be dismantled by 2nd May 2028, unless otherwise previously agreed in writing by the local planning authority.

Reason for condition: In the interests of the visual amenities of the area.

Condition : 5 - The colour of the electricity cabinet hereby permitted shall be green, unless otherwise previously agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 

Reason for condition: In the interests of the visual amenities of the area.

Condition : 6 - Landscaping  (Implementation) - All hard and soft landscape works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details as shown 51365-LUC-WXX-XX-SK-L-15210 LV Cabinet Landscape Proposals. The works shall be carried out in the first available planting season following the completion of the development or prior to the occupation of any part of the development, whichever is the sooner, and any trees which die within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased or are dying, shall be replaced in the next planting season with others of same approved specification, unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation. All hard surfacing and means of enclosure shall be completed before the development is first occupied.

Condition : 7 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
description: TEMPORARY INSTALLATION OF A LOW VOLTAGE POWER CABINET AND UTILITIES INFRASTRUCTURE
